00038 void test_SampledData()
00039 {
00040     if (os_) *os_ << "test_SampledData()\n";
00041     using namespace MatchedFilter;
00042 
00043     SampledData<DxD> sd;
00044     sd.domain = make_pair(0.0, 2.0);
00045     sd.samples.push_back(10);
00046     sd.samples.push_back(11);
00047     sd.samples.push_back(12);
00048     sd.samples.push_back(13);
00049     sd.samples.push_back(14);
00050 
00051     if (os_) *os_ << sd << endl; 
00052 
00053     if (os_) *os_ << "domainWidth: " << sd.domainWidth() << endl;
00054     unit_assert(sd.domainWidth() == 2.0);
00055 
00056     if (os_) *os_ << "dx: " << sd.dx() << endl;
00057     unit_assert(sd.dx() == .5); 
00058     
00059     for (unsigned int i=0; i<sd.samples.size(); i++)
00060     {
00061         if (os_) *os_ << "x(" << i << "): " << sd.x(i) << endl;
00062         unit_assert(sd.x(i) == i * .5);
00063     }
00064 
00065     unsigned int count = 0;
00066     for (double x=-.2; x<2.3; x+=.1, count++)
00067     {
00068         //if (os_) *os_ << "sampleIndex(" << x << "): " << sd.sampleIndex(x) << endl;
00069         unit_assert(sd.sampleIndex(x) == count/5);
00070         //if (os_) *os_ << "sample(" << x << "): " << sd.sample(x) << endl;
00071         unit_assert(sd.sample(x) == 10 + count/5);        
00072     }
00073 }
00074 
00075 
00076 // Kernel types defined as objects must define space_type in the class definition, 
00077 // or in a specialization of KernelTraitsBase<>.
00078 struct OneMinusAbs 
00079 {
00080     typedef MatchedFilter::DxD space_type;
00081     double operator()(double d) const {return (d>=-1 && d<=1) ? 1 - abs(d) : 0;} 
00082 };
00083 
00084 
00085 // KernelTraitsBase<> has default specialization for function pointer types
00086 complex<double> OneMinusAbsComplex(double d)
00087 {
00088     return (d>=-1 && d<=1) ? 1 - abs(d) : 0;  
00089 }

00091 
00092 template <typename Kernel>
00093 void test_createFilter(const Kernel& f)
00094 {
00095     using namespace MatchedFilter;
00096 
00097     if (os_) *os_ << "test_createFilter() " << typeid(f).name() << endl;
00098 
00099     int sampleRadius = 4;
00100     double dx = .25;
00101     double shift = 0;
00102 
00103     typedef typename KernelTraits<Kernel>::filter_type filter_type;
00104     typedef typename KernelTraits<Kernel>::abscissa_type abscissa_type;
00105     typedef typename KernelTraits<Kernel>::ordinate_type ordinate_type;
00106 
00107     filter_type filter = details::createFilter(f, sampleRadius, dx, shift);
00108 
00109     if (os_)
00110     {
00111         copy(filter.begin(), filter.end(), ostream_iterator<ordinate_type>(*os_, " "));
00112         *os_ << endl;
00113     }
00114 
00115     unit_assert((int)filter.size() == sampleRadius*2 + 1);
00116     for (int i=-sampleRadius; i<=sampleRadius; ++i)
00117         unit_assert(filter[sampleRadius+i] == f(i*dx - shift));
00118     
00119     if (os_) *os_ << endl;
00120 }
00121 
00122 
00123 template <typename Kernel>
00124 void test_createFilters(const Kernel& f)
00125 {
00126     using namespace MatchedFilter;
00127 
00128     if (os_) *os_ << "test_createFilters() " << typeid(f).name() << endl;
00129 
00130     int sampleRadius = 2;
00131     int subsampleFactor = 4;
00132     double dx = 1;
00133 
00134     typedef typename KernelTraits<Kernel>::filter_type filter_type;
00135     typedef typename KernelTraits<Kernel>::ordinate_type ordinate_type;
00136     vector<filter_type> filters = details::createFilters(f, 
00137                                                          sampleRadius, 
00138                                                          subsampleFactor, 
00139                                                          dx);
00140     
00141     // verify filter count
00142     unit_assert((int)filters.size() == subsampleFactor);
00143 
00144     for (typename vector<filter_type>::const_iterator it=filters.begin(); it!=filters.end(); ++it)
00145     {
00146         if (os_)
00147         {
00148             copy(it->begin(), it->end(), ostream_iterator<ordinate_type>(*os_, " "));
00149             *os_ << endl;
00150         }
00151 
00152         // verify filter size
00153         unit_assert((int)it->size() == sampleRadius*2 + 1);
00154     
00155         // verify filter normalization
00156         double sum = 0;
00157         for (typename filter_type::const_iterator jt=it->begin(); jt!=it->end(); ++jt)
00158             sum += norm(complex<double>(*jt));
00159         unit_assert_equal(sum, 1, 1e-14);
00160     }
00161 
00162     if (os_) *os_ << endl;
00163 }
00164 
00165 
00166 template <typename Kernel>
00167 void test_compute(const Kernel& f)
00168 {
00169     using namespace MatchedFilter;
00170 
00171     if (os_) *os_ << "test_compute() " << typeid(f).name() << endl;
00172 
00173     typename KernelTraits<Kernel>::sampled_data_type data;
00174     data.domain = make_pair(0, 10);
00175     data.samples.resize(11);
00176     data.samples[5] = 1.;
00177 
00178     if (os_) *os_ << "data: " << data << endl;
00179 
00180     int sampleRadius = 2;
00181     int sampleFactor = 4;
00182 
00183     typedef typename KernelTraits<Kernel>::correlation_data_type CorrelationData;
00184 
00185     CorrelationData correlationData = 
00186         computeCorrelationData(data, f, sampleRadius, sampleFactor); 
00187 
00188     if (os_) *os_ << "correlationData: " << correlationData << endl;
00189 
00190     unit_assert(correlationData.samples.size() == 41);
00191     unit_assert(abs(correlationData.samples[20].dot - 1.) < 1e-12);
00192 }

00195 template <typename Kernel>
00196 void test_kernel(const Kernel& kernel)
00197 {
00198     if (os_) *os_ << "***************************************************************\n";
00199     if (os_) *os_ << "test_kernel() " << typeid(kernel).name() << endl;
00200     if (os_) *os_ << "***************************************************************\n";
00201     if (os_) *os_ << endl;
00202 
00203     test_createFilter(kernel);
00204     test_createFilters(kernel);
00205     test_compute(kernel);
00206 }

00209 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00210 {
00211     try
00212     {
00213         if (argc>1 && !strcmp(argv[1],"-v")) os_ = &cout;
00214         if (os_) *os_ << "MatchedFilterTest\n";
00215 
00216         test_SampledData();
00217         test_kernel(OneMinusAbs()); 
00218         test_kernel(&OneMinusAbsComplex); 
00219 
00220         return 0;
00221     }
00222     catch (exception& e)
00223     {
00224         cerr << e.what() << endl;
00225         return 1;
00226     }
00227 }
